instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that already has a new 2017 GPU before I received it. Has a power problem with <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. When <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR> is soldered I have short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with no fan spin but when it is removed short gone and board powers up but no video. Tried replacement <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR> but no change

Can this be caused by shorted GPU since <RESISTOR>R5410</RESISTOR> is on GPU power rail?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Discard GPU power supply first.
If you are lucky enough, could be only bad <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> and short still remained. Removed GPU and short was gone.

Replaced GPU from SEE-IC and short returned.

Is short inside the board at this point??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
How can be the short inside board, if disappeared when you removed the GPU?

L8920 has very low value to ground because of GPU; this is normal of course.
But such low value is practically short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, when <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> is shorted D-S.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message: D-S?? = drain to source on the mosfet (i would guess he is saying?)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message: replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q8951</TRANSISTOR> and short was gone. board powered on for a few seconds and turned off again. Short returned. What to try next

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> got shorted again.
Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR>/51 and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> at same time.
Be sure <CAPACITOR>C8956</CAPACITOR> is OK; check its traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR>/51 and <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> at the same time and short returned as soon as board powered up.

<CAPACITOR>C8956</CAPACITOR> traces good

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> short
threads.message:
Which is the exact value of that short, on the GPU core rail?
004-009 on diode mode is normal for that board, I think.
A pure short there could kill <TRANSISTOR>Q8950</TRANSISTOR> once powered up, and same short will pass through it untill <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
